name: Name The Flavor Quiz | Food & Drink | 10 Questions

questions.text: What flavor of ice cream is considered to be a cross between Fruit Loops and Fruity Pebbles and also shares it's name with a lunar event?
questions.explanation:
Blue Moon.

	At one time, Blue Moon ice cream could only be found in areas of Michigan and Wisconsin, but can now be found in other areas on the East and West Coast. The flavor of Blue Moon ice cream is described as being a cross between Fruit Loops and Fruity Pebbles cereal.

questions.text: Known as harlequin ice cream, what flavor of ice cream came from Naples to the United States in 1870?
questions.explanation:
Neapolitan.

	Neapolitan ice cream was created in Naples, Italy during the 19th century. It is a combination of three flavors of ice cream. In Italy, Neapolitan ice cream is pistachio, cherry, and vanilla to match Italy's flag. In the United States, the flavors are chocolate, vanilla and strawberry.

questions.text: What flavor of ice cream has a key ingredient found on many breakfast plates?
questions.explanation:
Bacon.

	Bacon ice cream is made by mixing bacon bits with custard and freezing it. The ice cream flavor started out as a gag for April Fool's Day. The bacon bits are candied in syrup before added to the custard.

questions.text: A nut gives what ice cream its name and green coloring?
questions.explanation:
Pistachio.

	The pistachio nut is part of the cashew family. The nut gives ice cream its green coloring and flavor. Pistachio ice cream is a layer in Spumoni ice cream and in the dessert Baked Alaska.

questions.text: This Italian ice cream has layers of candied fruit and nuts between each of its three layers. What is it called?
questions.explanation:
Spumoni.

	Spumoni is Italian for foam. Spumoni is similar to Neopolitan, with the only difference being that Spumoni has layers of candied fruit and nuts between each of its three layers.

questions.text: Vampires would be repelled from this flavor of ice cream. To what flavor am I referring?
questions.explanation:
Garlic.

	Garlic ice cream is vanilla ice cream mixed with garlic. It is savory in taste and found at many garlic festivals. In some restaurants, garlic ice cream is used as a sauce to go with steaks.

questions.text: Large pieces of almonds, marshmallows, and chocolate pieces gave this ice cream flavor what name?
questions.explanation:
Rocky Road.

	In 1929, William Dreyer created Rocky Road ice cream when he used a pair of scissors to cut up marshmallows, almonds, and chocolate into his ice cream. Rocky Road ice cream received it's name due to the Great Depression and hope that people would find a way in their rocky road.

questions.text: In the 1920s, this flavor of ice cream was introduced to taste like a Heath candy bar. What name was it given?
questions.explanation:
Butter Brickle.

	Butter Brickle ice cream was first made by Blackstone Hotel in Omaha, Nebraska. The Heath candy bar the ice cream was said to taste like was developed in 1914.

questions.text: Out of a recipe from Italy, what flavor of ice cream gets its color and flavor strictly from cocoa powder?
questions.explanation:
Chocolate.

	Chocolate ice cream is one of the five most popular flavors of ice cream. Chocolate ice cream became popular in the United States around the 19th century. Codex Alimentarius, a collection of standards for food, states that chocolate flavoring comes from nonfat cocoa solids. The minimum fat content in chocolate ice cream should be eight percent.

questions.text: What colorful flavored ice cream is named after a superhero?
questions.explanation:
Superman.

	Superman ice cream is based on the colors in Superman's suit. The ice cream is a mixture of Blue Moon, Banana, and Strawberry.
